page.title: 11PLANS FOR TAUNTON'S CANAL
page.content: The Bridgwater and Taunton Canal is controlled by the British Waterways Board. In 1981,officers from the British Waterways Board and the county,district and borough councils drew up a consultative report on the future of the canal.In 1983 they decided to go for the optimum development of the canal's potential for recreation.To do this provision will be made for pleasure cruising, angling and informal recreation. A lot of money is needed from the British Waterways Board and Somerset County Council.Volunteers will help keep costs down.A realistic figure is Â£500,000.A start has been made,Â£60,000 in 1985. The authorities plan to keep a balance between recreation and nature conservation.
